security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate git workflow documentation skill. All 109 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES triggered by markdown documentation containing git command examples. No actual security risks present. The skill only provides reference documentation for git operations.

risk_factor_evidence.reasoning: These are git command examples in markdown documentation code blocks, not actual Ruby/shell backtick execution. The backticks are markdown syntax for inline code and code fences showing git commands like `lazygit`, `gh pr create`, `git diff | delta`. No code execution occurs.

Path sequences in documentation like `./references/rebase-patterns.md` are file references in markdown documentation, not path traversal vulnerabilities. These are relative paths to related documentation files within the skill.
The source_url field is legitimate metadata pointing to the GitHub repository. This is required for skill attribution and is not a security vulnerability.

content.user_title: Streamline Git Workflows with CLI Tools
content.value_statement: Managing git operations from the terminal can be complex. This skill provides quick access to lazygit, gh CLI, and delta for interactive staging, PR creation, and beautiful diffs.
actual_capabilities: Open lazygit interactive TUI for visual git operations
Create and manage pull requests using gh CLI
View beautiful syntax-highlighted diffs with delta
Stage, commit, push, and pull changes efficiently
Manage branches, stashes, and rebase operations
List and review issues and pull requests
limitations: Requires git, gh CLI, lazygit, and delta to be installed
Needs network access for GitHub operations like PR creation
Cannot execute git operations without user confirmation
Does not provide custom git scripting or automation

use_cases.title: Visual Git Staging and Committing
use_cases.description: Use lazygit TUI to stage files, write commits, and push changes without remembering command flags.
use_cases.target_user: Developers who prefer visual interfaces over command-line flags

use_cases.title: Create Pull Requests from Terminal
use_cases.description: Create, list, view, and merge pull requests using gh CLI commands directly from the terminal.
use_cases.target_user: Developers who want to stay in terminal for GitHub workflows

use_cases.title: Review Code with Beautiful Diffs
use_cases.description: View git diffs with syntax highlighting, side-by-side comparison, and clean formatting using delta.
use_cases.target_user: Code reviewers and developers examining changes

prompt_templates.scenario: Creating a pull request from terminal

prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the diff of my changes with delta syntax highlighting

output_examples.output: Opening lazygit interactive TUI. Use Space to stage/unstage, c to commit, p to push, b for branch operations, r for rebase, s for stash, ? for help.
Creating pull request with gh CLI. Use `gh pr create --title "Your Title" --body "Description"` or `gh pr create --web` to open in browser.
Run `git diff | delta` to view changes with syntax highlighting. Configure as default pager with `git config --global core.pager delta`.

best_practices: Use lazygit for complex staging operations to avoid accidental commits
Configure delta as your default pager for consistent diff viewing
Use `gh pr create --web` to verify PR appearance before submission
anti_patterns: Do not use `git push --force` on shared branches
Avoid large commits; break changes into logical pieces
Do not skip writing meaningful commit messages

faq.question: What tools does this skill require?
faq.answer: This skill requires git, gh CLI, lazygit, and delta to be installed on your system.

faq.question: Can I use this skill without network access?
faq.answer: Local git operations like staging, committing, and viewing diffs work offline. GitHub operations like creating PRs require network access.

faq.question: How do I exit lazygit?
faq.answer: Press `q` to quit lazygit. Use `?` to see all available keybindings.

faq.question: Can delta show side-by-side diffs?
faq.answer: Yes, use `git diff | delta --side-by-side` for parallel diff viewing.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my git configuration?
faq.answer: No, this skill only provides commands and documentation. Configuration changes require explicit user action.

faq.question: Can I create issues with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, use `gh issue create --title "Your title"` to create issues from the terminal.
